Urgently hiring forSalesforce Developer Remote  Role Description:You’ll be responsible for turning the program design of our Solution Architects and Technical Architects into a configured solution that meets the customer’s needs.Working predominantly in Agile scrum teams, you’ll be building out complex business processes using Service Cloud technology and the toolkit of the platform.You’ll be involved in all phases of the project lifecycle - from low-level design and development through to deployment and post-production support.You’ll acquire a deep product knowledge of the Salesforce Industries vertical applications, and will be able to mentor customer (and system integrator) resources and accelerate knowledge transfer to them.You’ll also act as a champion in the wider Salesforce Industries partner ecosystem, sharing best practices, lessons learned, and time-saving techniques. Minimum Requirements: ● 5+ years experience working on deployment teams, ideally using Agile development techniques.● Proven track record of successful delivery of customer projects, preferably enterprise CRM implementations.● Experience in building solutions in the Service, Sales and Experience cloud● Experience in Salesforce OOTB features - Lead Conversion, Web to Lead, Sales Path, Email to case, Omnichannel and skill based routing, Escalation and Assignment Rules. Case management, Case assignment, Case Escalation, Knowledge Articles.● A self-starter, adept at picking up new skills and technologies, and eager to break new ground.● Excellent communication skills, equally comfortable with crafting emails as leading a white-board discussion with customers or delivering a technical presentation.● Degree or equivalent relevant experience required. Experience will be evaluated based on the core competencies for the role (e.g. extracurricular leadership roles, military experience, volunteer roles, work experience, etc.)● Experience on agile methodologies● Experience in Salesforce deployment practices/strategies● Active Salesforce certifications or ability to achieve relevant certifications upon hire● Preferred Salesforce certifications:- Admin, PD1, PD2, Platform App Builder  Technical Requirements: ● Salesforce (Apex, VisualForce, Lightning)● Java, SOAP APIs, REST (JSON, XML)● Process modeling tools and best practices● Experience in Programmatic (Apex, LWC, Javascript) and Declarative (Low code) salesforce development● Knowledge of Javascript / Front-end design (HTML and CSS)Please reach out to me at +919899634637 or jbhatia@forcecraver.com to discuss further.

Urgently hiring forSalesforce Developer Remote  Role Description:You’ll be responsible for turning the program design of our Solution Architects and Technical Architects into a configured solution that meets the customer’s needs.Working predominantly in Agile scrum teams, you’ll be building out complex business processes using Service Cloud technology and the toolkit of the platform.You’ll be involved in all phases of the project lifecycle - from low-level design and development through to deployment and post-production support.You’ll acquire a deep product knowledge of the Salesforce Industries vertical applications, and will be able to mentor customer (and system integrator) resources and accelerate knowledge transfer to them.You’ll also act as a champion in the wider Salesforce Industries partner ecosystem, sharing best practices, lessons learned, and time-saving techniques. Minimum Requirements: ● 5+ years experience working on deployment teams, ideally using Agile development techniques.● Proven track record of successful delivery of customer projects, preferably enterprise CRM implementations.● Experience in building solutions in the Service, Sales and Experience cloud● Experience in Salesforce OOTB features - Lead Conversion, Web to Lead, Sales Path, Email to case, Omnichannel and skill based routing, Escalation and Assignment Rules. Case management, Case assignment, Case Escalation, Knowledge Articles.● A self-starter, adept at picking up new skills and technologies, and eager to break new ground.● Excellent communication skills, equally comfortable with crafting emails as leading a white-board discussion with customers or delivering a technical presentation.● Degree or equivalent relevant experience required. Experience will be evaluated based on the core competencies for the role (e.g. extracurricular leadership roles, military experience, volunteer roles, work experience, etc.)● Experience on agile methodologies● Experience in Salesforce deployment practices/strategies● Active Salesforce certifications or ability to achieve relevant certifications upon hire● Preferred Salesforce certifications:- Admin, PD1, PD2, Platform App Builder  Technical Requirements: ● Salesforce (Apex, VisualForce, Lightning)● Java, SOAP APIs, REST (JSON, XML)● Process modeling tools and best practices● Experience in Programmatic (Apex, LWC, Javascript) and Declarative (Low code) salesforce development● Knowledge of Javascript / Front-end design (HTML and CSS)Please reach out to me at +919899634637 or jbhatia@forcecraver.com to discuss further.

equivalent experience.Preferred Qualifications:Experience in Manufacturing or Industry 4.0.Familiarity with AWS IoT, Azure IoT, or similar platforms.Knowledge of IIoT security best practices.A GitHub Hi Greetings from Yasmesoft Inc.Job Title: Scada DeveloperLocation: RemoteOverview:We are a trailblazing Industrial IoT (IIoT) organization revolutionizing manufacturing with an advanced edge engineering platform. Powered by Ignition, HiveMQ, TimescaleDB, Kubernetes, and GitHub Actions, our solutions provide real-time insights and drive operational excellence. Join us to shape the future of smart manufacturing.Job Summary:We are seeking a Senior IIoT Developer to design, build, and enhance our cutting-edge IIoT platform. Reporting to the Chief Product Owner, you will be responsible for developing tools, integrations, and edge solutions for industrial environments. The ideal candidate will have expertise in SCADA, IIoT protocols, software development, and DevOps practices.Key Responsibilities:Develop and optimize platform features using Ignition, HiveMQ, and TimescaleDB.Build responsive front-end dashboards using HTML, CSS, and Java.Develop and maintain backend logic using Python and Java to process edge data and integrate systems.Deploy and manage containerized applications with Kubernetes.Automate CI/CD pipelines using GitHub Actions for efficient releases.Integrate industrial protocols such as MQTT, OPC UA, and Modbus.Ensure performance, Interested candidates can send your resume to naveen@kovantech.comJob Title: Java IVR DeveloperDuration: ContractLocation: RemoteJob description:We are seeking a highly skilled IVR Testing Specialist to join our team. The ideal candidate will have extensive experience in testing Interactive Voice Response (IVR) systems, with a strong focus on using Cyara for test automation. The role requires a deep understanding of both inbound and outbound IVR processes and hands-on experience with few of IVR development technologies / platforms like GDF, Watson, Amazon connect, Avaya, Genesys, and Nuance.Key Responsibilities:1. IVR Testing:o Develop and execute test plans for IVR systems, ensuring all functionalities are thoroughly tested.o Utilize Cyara for automated testing of IVR scripts and call flows.o Conduct manual testing as needed to validate specific scenarios and edge cases.2. System Integration:o Collaborate with development and deployment teams to ensure seamless integration of IVR systems with other platforms.o Test and validate the performance of IVR development technologies / platforms on GDF, Watson, Amazon connect, Avaya, Genesys, and Nuance platforms.3. Quality Assurance:o Identify and document defects, working closely with developers to resolve issues.o Perform regression testing to ensure new updates do not negatively impact existing functionalities.o Monitor and report on the quality and performance of IVR systems.4. Project Coordination:o Work with project managers to define testing timelines and deliverables.o Provide regular status updates and testing reports to stakeholders.5. Customer Experience:o Ensure the IVR system provides a positive and efficient customer experience.o Validate voice recognition accuracy and response times in GDF / Nuance-powered IVR applications.Qualifications:Experience:o Minimum of 4 years of experience in IVR testing.o Proven experience with Cyara, including test case creation and execution.o Hands-on experience with GDF, Watson, Amazon connect, Avaya, Genesys, and Nuance platforms.Skills:o Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.o Excellent written and verbal communication skills.o Ability to work independently and as part of a team.hashtag#ivr hashtag#javaivr hashtag#gdf hashtag#cyara hashtag#genesys hashtag#avaya hashtag#java hashtag#googledialogflow hashtag#vxml hashtag#automation hashtag#testing hashtag#nuance hashtag#voice hashtag#voicerecognition hashtag#watson hashtag#amazonconnect hashtag#manualtesting hashtag#resume hashtag#hiring hashtag#immedaitehiring

🚀Hiring: Platform SRE – Automation Developer / Site Reliability Engineer- hashtag#Mexico hashtag#remote 🚀Full-time Position This team's engineers support the growing consumer credit card business . The platform is built on a microservice architecture on a modern technology stack  hosted in AWS public cloud and uses state of the art development practices and tooling for  SDLC, with observability tools such as Datadog, Prometheus, Splunk, etc. Our engineers are responsible for applying strong software development and engineering  principles to support our primary mission, which is to safeguard the production environments.  We perform all the functions of a SRE team from production support, architecture design (or  redesign), automation, development and support of observability tooling, defining and  monitoring SLOs, and incident management. Note: We are not necessarily looking for people with previous SRE experience. Instead, we are  looking for strong engineers with a developer-oriented focus who are willing to expand their  areas of expertise.How will you fulfil your potential? Build and improve the observability and alerting • Apply your software engineering skills to automate away manual tasks and operational  support TOIL. • Work closely with application developers for domain-based observability • Support the upkeep of a production environment a 4 9’s by monitoring availability and  taking a holistic view of system health. • Create sustainable systems and services through automation and uplifts. • Drive incident management process and support a blameless post-mortems culture.  Command an incident at a minimum to mitigation. • Partner with development teams to improve services via rigorous testing and release  procedures. • Participate in system design consulting, platform management, and capacity planning. • Participate in infrastructure sizing and optimization. • Work closely with the Card partnerBasic Qualifications • Proficiency in Python (v3 preferred), along with one or more of the following: Go, Python,  C, C++, Java, Perl, Ruby or shell scripting. • BS degree in Computer Science or related technical field involving coding and / or  systems engineering. • Experience with algorithms, data structures and software design and/or Experience with  UNIX operating systems internals and / or networking.Preferred Qualifications • Coding beyond simple scripts. • Experience with observability/monitoring platforms such as Prometheus/Grafana,  Splunk. • Experience with AWS. • Experience with distributed systems design, maintenance, and troubleshooting. • Hands-on experience with debugging and optimizing code, as well as automation. • Strong interpersonal skills, drive, and ownership. • Solving novel problems from first principles.hashtag#mexico hashtag#remote hashtag#fulltime

equivalent experience.Preferred Qualifications:Experience in Manufacturing or Industry 4.0.Familiarity with AWS IoT, Azure IoT, or similar platforms.Knowledge of IIoT security best practices.A GitHub Urgently hiring forSalesforce Developer Remote  Role Description:You’ll be responsible for turning the program design of our Solution Architects and Technical Architects into a configured solution that meets the customer’s needs.Working predominantly in Agile scrum teams, you’ll be building out complex business processes using Service Cloud technology and the toolkit of the platform.You’ll be involved in all phases of the project lifecycle - from low-level design and development through to deployment and post-production support.You’ll acquire a deep product knowledge of the Salesforce Industries vertical applications, and will be able to mentor customer (and system integrator) resources and accelerate knowledge transfer to them.You’ll also act as a champion in the wider Salesforce Industries partner ecosystem, sharing best practices, lessons learned, and time-saving techniques. Minimum Requirements: ● 5+ years experience working on deployment teams, ideally using Agile development techniques.● Proven track record of successful delivery of customer projects, preferably enterprise CRM implementations.● Experience in building solutions in the Service, Sales and Experience cloud● Experience in Salesforce OOTB features - Lead Conversion, Web to Lead, Sales Path, Email to case, Omnichannel and skill based routing, Escalation and Assignment Rules. Case management, Case assignment, Case Escalation, Knowledge Articles.● A self-starter, adept at picking up new skills and technologies, and eager to break new ground.● Excellent communication skills, equally comfortable with crafting emails as leading a white-board discussion with customers or delivering a technical presentation.● Degree or equivalent relevant experience required. Experience will be evaluated based on the core competencies for the role (e.g. extracurricular leadership roles, military experience, volunteer roles, work experience, etc.)● Experience on agile methodologies● Experience in Salesforce deployment practices/strategies● Active Salesforce certifications or ability to achieve relevant certifications upon hire● Preferred Salesforce certifications:- Admin, PD1, PD2, Platform App Builder  Technical Requirements: ● Salesforce (Apex, VisualForce, Lightning)● Java, SOAP APIs, REST (JSON, XML)● Process modeling tools and best practices● Experience in Programmatic (Apex, LWC, Javascript) and Declarative (Low code) salesforce development● Knowledge of Javascript / Front-end design (HTML and CSS)Please reach out to me at +919899634637 or jbhatia@forcecraver.com to discuss further.

Interested candidates can send your resume to naveen@kovantech.comJob Title: Java IVR DeveloperDuration: ContractLocation: RemoteJob description:We are seeking a highly skilled IVR Testing Specialist to join our team. The ideal candidate will have extensive experience in testing Interactive Voice Response (IVR) systems, with a strong focus on using Cyara for test automation. The role requires a deep understanding of both inbound and outbound IVR processes and hands-on experience with few of IVR development technologies / platforms like GDF, Watson, Amazon connect, Avaya, Genesys, and Nuance.Key Responsibilities:1. IVR Testing:o Develop and execute test plans for IVR systems, ensuring all functionalities are thoroughly tested.o Utilize Cyara for automated testing of IVR scripts and call flows.o Conduct manual testing as needed to validate specific scenarios and edge cases.2. System Integration:o Collaborate with development and deployment teams to ensure seamless integration of IVR systems with other platforms.o Test and validate the performance of IVR development technologies / platforms on GDF, Watson, Amazon connect, Avaya, Genesys, and Nuance platforms.3. Quality Assurance:o Identify and document defects, working closely with developers to resolve issues.o Perform regression testing to ensure new updates do not negatively impact existing functionalities.o Monitor and report on the quality and performance of IVR systems.4. Project Coordination:o Work with project managers to define testing timelines and deliverables.o Provide regular status updates and testing reports to stakeholders.5. Urgently hiring forSalesforce Developer Remote  Role Description:You’ll be responsible for turning the program design of our Solution Architects and Technical Architects into a configured solution that meets the customer’s needs.Working predominantly in Agile scrum teams, you’ll be building out complex business processes using Service Cloud technology and the toolkit of the platform.You’ll be involved in all phases of the project lifecycle - from low-level design and development through to deployment and post-production support.You’ll acquire a deep product knowledge of the Salesforce Industries vertical applications, and will be able to mentor customer (and system integrator) resources and accelerate knowledge transfer to them.You’ll also act as a champion in the wider Salesforce Industries partner ecosystem, sharing best practices, lessons learned, and time-saving techniques. Minimum Requirements: ● 5+ years experience working on deployment teams, ideally using Agile development techniques.● Proven track record of successful delivery of customer projects, preferably enterprise CRM implementations.● Experience in building solutions in the Service, Sales and Experience cloud● Experience in Salesforce OOTB features - Lead Conversion, Web to Lead, Sales Path, Email to case, Omnichannel and skill based routing, Escalation and Assignment Rules. Case management, Case assignment, Case Escalation, Knowledge Articles.● A self-starter, adept at picking up new skills and technologies, and eager to break new ground.● Excellent communication skills, equally comfortable with crafting emails as leading a white-board discussion with customers or delivering a technical presentation.● Degree or equivalent relevant experience required. Experience will be evaluated based on the core competencies for the role (e.g. extracurricular leadership roles, military experience, volunteer roles, work experience, etc.)● Experience on agile methodologies● Experience in Salesforce deployment practices/strategies● Active Salesforce certifications or ability to achieve relevant certifications upon hire● Preferred Salesforce certifications:- Admin, PD1, PD2, Platform App Builder  Technical Requirements: ● Salesforce (Apex, VisualForce, Lightning)● Java, SOAP APIs, REST (JSON, XML)● Process modeling tools and best practices● Experience in Programmatic (Apex, LWC, Javascript) and Declarative (Low code) salesforce development● Knowledge of Javascript / Front-end design (HTML and CSS)Please reach out to me at +919899634637 or jbhatia@forcecraver.com to discuss further.

Interested candidates can send your resume to naveen@kovantech.comJob Title: Java IVR DeveloperDuration: ContractLocation: RemoteJob description:We are seeking a highly skilled IVR Testing Specialist to join our team. The ideal candidate will have extensive experience in testing Interactive Voice Response (IVR) systems, with a strong focus on using Cyara for test automation. The role requires a deep understanding of both inbound and outbound IVR processes and hands-on experience with few of IVR development technologies / platforms like GDF, Watson, Amazon connect, Avaya, Genesys, and Nuance.Key Responsibilities:1. IVR Testing:o Develop and execute test plans for IVR systems, ensuring all functionalities are thoroughly tested.o Utilize Cyara for automated testing of IVR scripts and call flows.o Conduct manual testing as needed to validate specific scenarios and edge cases.2. System Integration:o Collaborate with development and deployment teams to ensure seamless integration of IVR systems with other platforms.o Test and validate the performance of IVR development technologies / platforms on GDF, Watson, Amazon connect, Avaya, Genesys, and Nuance platforms.3. Quality Assurance:o Identify and document defects, working closely with developers to resolve issues.o Perform regression testing to ensure new updates do not negatively impact existing functionalities.o Monitor and report on the quality and performance of IVR systems.4. Project Coordination:o Work with project managers to define testing timelines and deliverables.o Provide regular status updates and testing reports to stakeholders.5. Customer Experience:o Ensure the IVR system provides a positive and efficient customer experience.o Validate voice recognition accuracy and response times in GDF / Nuance-powered IVR applications.Qualifications:Experience:o Minimum of 4 years of experience in IVR testing.o Proven experience with Cyara, including test case creation and execution.o Hands-on experience with GDF, Watson, Amazon connect, Avaya, Genesys, and Nuance platforms.Skills:o Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.o Excellent written and verbal communication skills.o Ability to work independently and as part of a team.hashtag#ivr hashtag#javaivr hashtag#gdf hashtag#cyara hashtag#genesys hashtag#avaya hashtag#java hashtag#googledialogflow hashtag#vxml hashtag#automation hashtag#testing hashtag#nuance hashtag#voice hashtag#voicerecognition hashtag#watson hashtag#amazonconnect hashtag#manualtesting hashtag#resume hashtag#hiring hashtag#immedaitehiring
